summary.purpose: Provides utilities for sending emails via SendGrid and creating email attachments from files, buffers, or URLs.
summary.problem_solved: Abstracts the complexity of SendGrid API integration, email group resolution, CC merging, attachment encoding, and audit logging into reusable helper functions.

external.name: @sendgrid/mail
external.why_used: Used to send transactional emails via the SendGrid API.

external.name: fs
external.why_used: Used to read file contents synchronously when creating attachments from file paths.

external.name: path
external.why_used: Used to extract file extensions and base names for MIME type detection and attachment naming.

internal.why_used: Imports add_audit_record, get_document_by_id, and ignore_ssl_request helpers.
Imports EmailSettings, EmailData, and EmailAttachment type definitions.
Imports the logger singleton for error and debug logging.

exports.name: create_attachment_from_file
exports.description_one_line: Reads a local file and returns a base64-encoded EmailAttachment object.

exports.name: create_attachment_from_buffer
exports.description_one_line: Converts a Buffer or Uint8Array into a base64-encoded EmailAttachment object.

exports.name: create_attachment_from_url

symbols.name: create_attachment_from_file
symbols.description_one_line: Reads a local file and returns a base64-encoded EmailAttachment object.

params.name: file_path
params.description: Absolute or relative path to the local file to attach.

params.name: filename
params.description: Override for the attachment filename. Defaults to the file's basename.

returns.description: An EmailAttachment object with base64 content, filename, MIME type, and disposition.

details.what_it_does: Reads the file synchronously using fs.readFileSync, encodes it as base64, detects the MIME type from the file extension, and returns an EmailAttachment object.

error_cases.condition: File does not exist or cannot be read
error_cases.behavior: Logs the error via logger.error and re-throws it.

minimal_correct.title: Create attachment from a PDF file

symbols.name: create_attachment_from_buffer
symbols.description_one_line: Converts a Buffer or Uint8Array into a base64-encoded EmailAttachment object.

params.name: buffer
params.description: The binary data to encode as an attachment.

params.name: filename
params.description: The filename to use for the attachment.

params.name: mime_type
params.description: The MIME type of the attachment (e.g., 'application/pdf').

returns.description: An EmailAttachment object with base64-encoded content.

details.what_it_does: Ensures the input is a proper Buffer (converting Uint8Array if needed), encodes it as base64, and returns an EmailAttachment object. This is a synchronous operation.

minimal_correct.title: Create attachment from an in-memory buffer
minimal_correct.code:
const pdfBuffer = await generatePdf();
const attachment = create_attachment_from_buffer(pdfBuffer, 'invoice.pdf', 'application/pdf');

symbols.name: create_attachment_from_url
symbols.description_one_line: Downloads a remote file and returns a base64-encoded EmailAttachment object.

params.name: url
params.description: The URL of the remote file to download.

params.name: filename
params.description: The filename to use for the attachment.

returns.type: Promise<{ content: string; filename: string; type: string; disposition: string }>
returns.description: An attachment object with base64 content, filename, content-type, and disposition 'attachment'.

details.what_it_does: Uses ignore_ssl_request (axios with optional SSL bypass in QA) to download the file as an arraybuffer, converts it to base64, and reads the content-type from the response headers (defaulting to 'application/pdf').

error_cases.condition: HTTP request fails or times out (20s timeout)
error_cases.behavior: Logs the error via logger.error and re-throws it.

minimal_correct.title: Create attachment from a remote PDF URL

symbols.name: send_email
symbols.description_one_line: Sends an email via SendGrid using settings fetched from Firestore, with group resolution and audit logging.

params.name: email_data
params.description: Email payload including subject, to, from, cc, group_name, body_html or body_plain_text, entity_for_audit, and optional attachments.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options. When debug is true, logs success and payload details.

returns.description: Resolves when the email is sent and audit record is created. Errors are caught and logged (not re-thrown).

details.what_it_does: Fetches email settings (API key, groups, default_from, default_cc) from Firestore 'nx-settings/emails'. Resolves group_name to recipient lists, merges CC arrays, sets the SendGrid API key, constructs the MailDataRequired message, sends it, and writes an audit record. Errors are swallowed (logged but not re-thrown).

error_cases.behavior: Throws a string error: "must supply a 'group_name' or 'to' value"
Throws a string error: "must supply a 'body_plain_text' or 'html' value"

error_cases.condition: group_name is provided but not found in settings.groups
error_cases.behavior: Throws a string error: "must supply a valid 'group_name'"

error_cases.condition: SendGrid returns a non-202 status code
error_cases.behavior: Throws the response body; error is caught and logged.
